page.title: 03RON BROWN MP
page.content: {RON BROWN}who is the labour MP for Leith, was elected in 1979 to Parlia- :ment. He doesn't think of himself as an important person, but as an every- :day man who was fortunate enough to be selected to be an MP. Before go- :ing to Westminster he worked as a shop steward in Parsons Peebles. He was once involved in a bad accident and had to have skin grafts on his face. He has two children who attend Ainslie Park High School. Ron Brown lives in a small flat in Kensington when Parliament is sitting, but his main home is in Edinburgh. As an MP he has travelled to many countries, including Afghanistan and Libya. When asked if he would like to be Prime Minister he said if he were chosen to be Prime Minister he would accept - but he's happy as he is!
